event,"Today...w0weey today. Where to begin. OK here it goes.

Last week Karen told Caleb that she couldn't work Wednesday (today) of this week. So Caleb had to go into the computer and delete her off of the schedule for today. This had many many many bad effects. It changed me, Daniel Rodrigs, Daniel Halls and Sammys schedule times for this week. So as an effect I was ""late"" two days in a row (but not by my schedule at home. Their schedule at the store said I was). The same thing happened to the previously mentioned boys.

The way this action effected todays schedule is as follows. Caleb told me last week that I would no longer be opening (4:45) but coming in at 6:30 and that Lyn would be opening instead of me. Since there had been so much confusion about my schedule this week. I go up to the store on Tuesday night to double check my schedule. Well, the daily schedule said that I was supposed to open (4:45) and the weekly one said that I was supposed to be in at 6:30. So I ask Tim what to do and he tells me to call Lyn to make sure she knows about the change. Well, her phone didn't work so then Tim advised me just to come in at open anyways and if Lyn showed up, just to go home. So I sucked it up and said ""fine.""

So it's early early early Tuesday morning and the time is 3:15 when I go to sleep (I have to be awake at 4). So I wake up at 4 (45 minutes of sleep) and as I'm driving to work I stop by 7-11 and get an energy drink (this is where my health trouble started and keep in mind I had nothing in my stomach at the time). Then I go to work and I'm there for about 15 minutes opening with Steve and I say to him ""Ya know, I keep imagining Lyn's car coming around that corner and saving me from my lack of sleep."" I kid you not, like 3 seconds later her little silver bug whips around that corner and I scream ""OH GOD YES!"" (It sounded kind of sexual so I think I freaked Steve out...but I was just releaved.) So Lyn comes in and me, her and Steve look at the daily schedule and we have to COMPLETELY re-write it.

So then I go home, sleep for another 45 minutes (making a total combined amount of sleep at an hour and a half.) I come back and work from 6:30-1:30. During my lunch though, all I had was another EFFIN HUGE energy drink. (Contents of my stomach at that point were two huge energy drinks) which happened to be the only thing keeping me awake...the ONLY thing!

On top of all this, the high school had early release so we had all the little monsters in our store all day *bah!* OK, so I finally get to go home at 1:30 and it felt freaking great! I get home (not feeling too hot) take a shower and I still felt like poo. Then Daniel calls me and asks (honestly thinking I'd say yes) to closing tonight after the morning I'd had. The kicker is, it was covering for Robert...I hate hate hate him...so it was a hell no.

Anywho, so I got dressed and told myself that if I went out and did something that I'd feel better. So I go to Wal-Mart, Old Navy and Payless and I got a new pair of sandles. Then I decided it was probably a good ideah to come on home cause I wasn't feeling any better and it was DEFINATLY affecting my driving skills. I thought though, that I'd stop off at my old Sonic before I came home.

OK, normally I pull up and see a whole bunch of people I don't know *bummer*...not today though...lol. I pull up and I see Negar, Renee and Brandon walking around *smiles!* Haha...then Brandon skates up with the courtesy tray...hehe (this made me smile) He's like ""My friend told me there was a hot girl over here in this car so naturally I had to come check it out."" I was like ""Damn straight."" The best part was he was wearing ...ROLLER SKATES! Lol.....oh it was funny. Then I got to talk to Renee who I haven't seen in the longest time. Ahh...I miss those people...but God how I DON'T miss that job. Starbucks is home now.
Anywho, so I come home and get into my comfy clothes and lay in bed hoping to feel better and I feel asleep at about 8 and woke up at 1. Which means it'll probably be another night of 4 am bed times.
Lord, could ya maybe perhaps HELP ME OUT HERE!
Anywho, thanks for reading the ramblings of a crazy lady

event,"So ya know how some whiney boy made that article about ""Nice guys"" and (girls) all of you know that after you read it you said ""GOD...what a load of bull shit!"". I know that all of you have always wanted someone to write one for the nice girls out there. Well here it is...Someone finally did...an ode to us nice girls.
This rant was written because a nice girl finally snapped.
I've read the tribute to the nice guys
column2: this is my response.

column1: This is my tribute to the nice girls. To the nice girls who are overlooked, who become friends and nothing more, who spend hours fixating upon their looks and their personalities and their actions because it must be they that are doing something wrong. This is for the girls who don't give it up on the first date, who don't want to play mind games, who provide a comforting hug and a supportive audience for a story they've heard a thousand times. This is for the girls who understand that they aren't perfect and that the guys they're interested in aren't either, for the girls who flirt and laugh and worry and obsess over the slightest glance, whisper, touch, because somehow they are able to keep alive that hope that maybe... maybe this time he'll have understood. This is an homage to the girls who laugh loud and often, who are comfortable in skirts and sweats and combat boots, who care more than they should for guys who don't deserve their attention. This is for those girls who have been in the trenches, who have watched other girls time and time again fake up and make up and fuck up the guys in their lives without saying a word. This is for the girls who have been there from the beginning and have heard the trite words of advice, from ""there are plenty of fish in the sea,"" to ""time heals all wounds."" This is to honor those girls who know that guys are just as scared as they are, who know that they deserve better, who are seeking to find it.

This is for the girls who have never been in love, but know that it's an experience that they don't want to miss out on. For the girls who have sought a night with friends and been greeted by a night of catcalling, rude comments and explicit invitations that they'd rather not have experienced. This is for the girls who have spent their weekends sitting on the sidelines of a beer pong tournament or a case race, or playing Florence Nightingale for a vomiting guy friend or a comatose crush, who have received a drunk phone call just before dawn from someone who doesn't care enough to invite them over but is still willing to pass out in their bed. This is for the girls who have left sad song lyrics in their away messages, who have tried to make someone understand through a subliminally appealing profile, who have time and time again dropped their male friend hint after hint after hint only to watch him chase after the first blonde girl in a skirt. This is for the girls who have been told that they're too good or too smart or too pretty, who have been given compliments as a way of breaking off a relationship, who have ever been told they are only wanted as a friend.
This one's for the girls who you can take home to mom, but won't because it's easier to sleep with a whore than foster a relationship
column2: this is for the girls who have been led on by words and kisses and touches, all of which were either only true for the moment, or never real to begin with. This is for the girls who have allowed a guy into their head and heart and bed, only to discover that he's just not ready, he's just not over her, he's just not looking to be tied down
column3: this is for the girls who believe the excuses because it's easier to believe that it's not that they don't want you, it's that they don't want anyone. This is for the girls who have had their hearts broken and their hopes dashed by someone too cavalier to have cared in the first place
column4: this is for the nights spent dissecting every word and syllable and inflection in his speech, for the nights when you've returned home alone, for the nights when you've seen from across the room him leaning a little too close, or standing a little too near, or talking a little too softly for the girl he's with to be a random hookup. This is for the girls who have endured party after party in his presence, finally having realized that it wasn't that he didn't want a relationship: it was that he didn't want you. I honor you for the night his dog died or his grandmother died or his little brother crashed his car and you held him, thinking that if you only comforted him just right, or said the right words, or rubbed his back in the right way then perhaps he'd realize what it was that he already had. This is for the night you realized that it would never happen, and the sunrise you saw the next morning after failing to sleep.

column1: This is for the ""I really like you, so let's still be friends"" comment after you read more into a situation than he ever intended
column2: this is for never realizing that when you choose friends, you seldom choose those which make you cry yourself to sleep. This is for the hugs you've received from your female friends, for the nights they've reassured you that you are beautiful and intelligent and amazing and loyal and truly worthy of a great guy
column3: this is for the despair you all felt as you sat in the aftermath of your tears, knowing that that night the only companionship you'd have was with a pillow and your teddy bear. This is for the girls who have been used and abused, who have endured what he was giving because at least he was giving something
column4: this is for the stupidity of the nights we've believed that something was better than nothing, though his something was nothing we'd have ever wanted. This is for the girls who have been satisified with too little and who have learned never to expect anything more: for the girls who don't think that they deserve more, because they've been conditioned for so long to accept the scraps thrown to them by guys.

column1: This is what I don't understand. Men sit and question and whine that girls are only attracted to the mean guys, the guys who berate them and belittle them and don't appreciate them and don't want them
column2: who use them for sex and think of little else than where their next conquest will be made. Men complain that they never meet nice girls, girls who are genuinely interested and compelling, who are intelligent and sweet and smart and beautiful
column3: men despair that no good women want to share in their lives, that girls play mindgames, that girls love to keep them hanging. Yet, men, I ask you: were you to meet one of these genuinely interested, thrillingly compelling, interesting and intelligent and sweet and beautiful and smart girls, were you to give her your number and wait for her to call... and if you were to receive a call from her the next day and she, in her truthful, loyal, intelligent and straightforward nice girl fashion, were to tell you that she finds you intriguing and attractive and interesting and worth her time and perhaps material from which she could fashion a boyfriend, would you or would you not immediately call your friends to tell them of the ""stalker chick"" you'd met the night prior, who called you and wore her heart on her sleeve and told the truth? And would you, or would you not, refuse to make plans with her, speak with her, see her again, and once again return to the bar or club or party scene and search once more for this ""nice girl"" who you just cannot seem to find? Because therein lies the truth, guys: we nice girls are everywhere. But you're not looking for a nice girl. You're not looking for someone genuinely interested in your intermural basketball game, or your anatomy midterm grade, or that argument you keep having with your father
column4: you're looking for a quick fix, a night when you can pretend to have a connection with another human being which is just as disposable as the condom you were using during it.

column1: So don't say you're on the lookout for nice girls, guys, when you pass us up on every step you take. Sometimes we go undercover
column2: sometimes we go in disguise: sometimes when that girl in the low cut shirt or the too tight miniskirt won't answer your catcalls, sometimes you're looking at a nice girl in whore's clothing - - we might say we like the attention, we might blush and giggle and turn back to our friends, but we're all thinking the same thing: ""This isn't me. Tomorrow morning, I'll be wearing a teeshirt and flannel shorts, I'll have slept alone and I'll be making my hungover best friend breakfast. See through the disguise. See me."" You never do. Why? Because you only see the exterior, you only see the slutty girl who welcomes those advances. You don't want the nice girl.. so don't say you're looking for a relationship: relationships take time and energy and intent, three things we're willing to extend - - but in return, we're looking for compassion and loyalty and trust, three things you never seem willing to express. Maybe nice guys finish last, but in the race they're running they're chasing after the whores and the sluts and the easy-targets... the nice girls are waiting at the finish line with water and towels and a congradulatory hug (and yes, if she's a nice girl and she likes you, the sweatiness probably won't matter), hoping against hope that maybe you'll realize that they're the ones that you want at the end of that silly race.

column1: So maybe it won't last forever. Maybe some of those guys in that race will turn in their running shoes and make their way to the concession stand where we're waiting
column2: however, until that happens, we still have each other, that silly race to watch, and all the chocolate we can eat (because what's a concession stand at a race without some chocolate?)

event,"So, I'm trying to write an essay about why we shold have prayer in public schools, I'd like some feedback so I'm gonna post it up on here and you guys let me know what you think.

The public school system is limiting our freedom of expression.

Our constatution also states that we should have the freedom of speech to say what we will. event,"So today...hmmm not much went on. I had to open this morning which means that I had to get up at 4:30 to be at work at 5:15...yes folks...that's right...AM!!! It actually wasn't too bad today. Anywho I got off work at 2ish and then came home only to realize that my Mom needed for me to run errands...I would have rather chewed my hand off...lol. I did them anyways though. So I came home and took a VERY MUCH NEEDED nap. OOH! I have a funny story about that nap...so I'm taking a nap and I'm sound asleep and then I wake up to my phone ringing...it's Liz...after I see her name on the caller ID I look at the time on my phone and it said 7:25 (Sidenote: I didn't know how long I'd been asleep and I have to  work the next day at 7:30) So my phone went gay and disconnected and then I FREAKED OUT and threw on my clothes and jacket and gloves and grabbed my bag and then I ran out into the kitchen/living room area and looked out the window and it was pitch black and there was my whole family watching TV...and I thought to myself (""hmmm...they're all up un-normally early"") and then I was like ""Mom, what day is it?""................."".....Saterday"" she said *GROANED AND TRIED TO KICK MYSELF!* I totally thought that I was gonna be late for work but it was still the day before...damn me and my naps. The sad part is....this exact situation happens to me all the time...I wake up not knowing what day it is. (I swear I DO NOT drink or do drugs). I'm just crazy. ...or at least I've been told that so many times that I'm starting to believe it.

Anywho...I've also been told that I think too much. Like..I was reading Katies Xanga and she had pictures of her great great grampa on there and her grandparents when they were kids and I was thinking...I wonder who I'll be with when I'm like 80 or 90. I mean...I know none of us can picture ourselves when we're that old...but I mean it's inevitable (unless *heaven forbid*...you die young). So I mean I wonder who I'll grow old with. I wonder if there realy IS a ""lid for every pot"" (as my Nana likes to say). It's also weird to think that most people get married in their mid to late 20's and I'm less than a year away from being 20 which means that in the next five years I'll meet that person that I'm gonna grow old with. SO WEIRD to think about. Haha...me and Rachel used to talk about soul mates and who we thought ours were...oh man those were interesting talks. I think that's the first time anyone actually thought my ""soulmate theory"" was kinda cool to think about. OH! I don't think I've told my soul mate theory on here before. OK...so here it is. When all souls are up on heaven and the angels are carrying the souls to God to be made into babies...God  takes the one ""super soul"" and divides it in half into a girl and boy soul and then shoots those souls into babies on earth. The babies could be as far away from one another as Paris and Hawaii but those two souls are like magnets...through out their lifetime they're drawn together and they keep coming closer and closer to one another untill one day they finally are re-united...BUT...what they do with that once they are re-united is up to  them. So anywho...that's my theory on soulmates. I like it...and that's all that matters. It's just odd to think that far into the future and know that it's coming and every day it gets closer and closer. Even as I'm typing this post it keeps getting closer. Whatever happens though...I just want to have a happy family and a happy marriage. I've seen how an unhappy marriage can make an unhappy family...that's the last thing I'd ever want to happen. Actually...I think I can call that ""worst night mare come true"" if it ever does happen.

Haha...w0w...people are definatly right about me...I REALY DO think way too much! lol. Anywho...I guess that's it for today...oh...but I would just like to say that we (Class of '04) have just lost an incredible sould recently. Lindsey Ivy passed away. I was in Softball with Lindsey our freshman  year...that girl was special...and I'm not talking about...oh ya know she was a cool kid special...I mean that she was one of the most forward thinking people I've ever known. She was like a re-incarnated female version of John Lennon. She asked the tough questions...and answered the even tougher ones and then asked us to answer them for ourselves. She challenged us to start thinking...she was a great person. I didn't keep in touch with her after our freshman year...which is a shame cause she lives like 3 houses down from me. But I guess I just wanted to say something about her 'cause I think she desearves it. She will be missed, but she's in good company right now...I bet her and Lennon are having some amazing discussion right now up in heaven. She's in a better place. Keep her family in your prayers though.
Well I guess that's gonna be it for today.

event,"w0w! OK so today wasn't the best one. So I go into work today at noon and I'm working for a couple hours and I get this call on the radio and it's Mark (the head of human resources) and he wants for me and Mary (the lead in my department) to come to his office. So we get in there and it turns out that there have been ""complaints"" about me. One is that...(ok here's what happened). Last week we were staying later than usual to finish cleaning up the floor and when it came time for them to kick us out...my friend Sabrina made an anouncement since all the customers were gone. She was trying to say ""Attention all Bass Pro associates...you can go home."" But she totally screwed it up and it was kinda funny and we were all laughing. So I get on the radio and I'm kidding around with her (like we all do) and I'm like ""hey nice brain fart"". So it turns out *as Mark is telling me* that a customer and some associates found it offensive. OK first of all...ALL the customers were gone. Second of all...no associates found it offensive...because they've all said stupider things over the radio. Then Mark procides to tell me that I cussed out a fellow associate which is total BS because I've never ever ever done that nor would I even consider doing that. But...since they couldn't prove that I said that, the reason they were putting down for termination is the use of the word ""brain fart"". Is that not the gayest thing you've ever heard in your entire life?! I actually laughed...I walked out of that office smiling from ear to ear though because not only was that the funniest thing I'd heard in a long time but I'm finally done with this job that made me MISERABLE! Like seriously...more miserable than Sonic...(if that's even possible.)

So I was driving home and I was like ""I need some comfort drink"". So I head on up to starbucks to get me a caramel apple cider *YUMMM!* So while I'm there I have a strike of genius and I pick up a Starbucks application and they said I have a good chance of being hired. Then I went over to Barnes & Noble and picked one up but they're not hiring till January. Then it was over to Life Way Christian Store but they're not hiring till February. Then I headed over to the place that I tan at and got one and they said that they're not hiring but they are moving some people around and to come up on Monday and talk to the manager. Then I called Danley to see if Chillis was hiring...left a message...bla bla bla.

So I get home and I'm watching Christmas movies and Danley gives me a call back and he's like ""yeah we're hiring and you'll probably get hired on the spot and yada yada."" So I'm like SCOOOOORE! I love working with food in food service anyways...it's more fun and I'm realy good at it. So anywho...tomorrow I can go to church and out to lunch with my Dad and just relax for the first Sunday in a while. Anywho...wish me luck in finding a new job.

event,"So today I looked in the mirror and realized it had been a month since I dyed my hair last and you could definatly see my very blonde roots coming out so I went and picked Brianna up from school and headed on over to Walgreens to pick up some hair dye. Once I got there though I soon realized that they didn't have the kind that I get so I zipped on over to Kroger and got it and then on the way back on the intersection of Moore and Sandy lake (where I usually turn left to get back to my house)...there were orange cones blocking where you're supposed to turn left and I didn't see in time and freaking ran right over them with a brigade of Cops and Fireman watching and laughing at me. So then I had to turn around...go back over them and haul ass to get out of sight at the chance they might give me a ticket. I don't think they would have though 'cause they were all too busy laughing at me and I could see the look of pity on their faces cause I was totally freaking out.
Anywho...that's been my day so far...hopefully tonight will be slightly more amusing for me.
event,"lol...I love that title. So random. Well I haven't done one of these in a while. It's gotten colder since then.
